text:
There's a strange behavior in Apache 2.0 when logging user names used to log in 
into protected areas of the server together with using ErrorDocument 401 
directive.

We need to tell apart the initial 401 responses that trigger displaying of the 
authorization box (empty username) and the actual log in attempt (i.e. some 
username) in order to track the failed login attempts.

Without the ErrorDocument 401, the (possibly bogus) username is logged all 
right. If case of ErrorDocument 401 "some text" it works as well, but if using 
ErrorDocument 401 /somepage.html the username is always logged as a dash!

I think it does not make any sense and we currently need to work around this by 
including the entire page into the apache config file.
creator: mammal@vol.cz

text:
If you change the "%u" to "%<u" in the relevant LogFormat line, the original
username will always be logged, even when an ErrorDocument page is configured.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
